monitr 0.0.0.9000

Life policies portfolio (n x 2 rows for each policy).

Source: R/data.R
lifepolicies.Rd

Simulated life insurance policies portfolio made up of 2,500 policies. Note that this type of dataset is suited to be passed as input in the function optimize_exposure(). This because it has n x 2 rows for each policy, where n is the number of years the policy is in force.

lifepolicies

Format

A data frame with variables:

Policy_id

policy number identifier, unique for each policy.

Inception_date

signing date of the contract.

Term_date

ending date of the contract.

Birth_date

date of birth of the policyolder.

Gender

policyholder's gender.

UY

underwriting year.

CY

current year of evaluation.

Claim_date

date when claims occurred, if any, otherwise 2099-12-31.

Claim

1 if the year of Claim_date is equal to CY, 0 otherwise.

Lapse_date

date when policy lapsed, if so, otherwise 2099-12-31.

Lapse

1 if the year of Lapse_date is equal to CY, 0 otherwise.

Examples

data(lifepolicies)
head(lifepolicies)

#> # A tibble: 6 x 11
#>   Policy_id Inception_date Term_date  Birth_date Gender    UY    CY Claim_date
#>       <dbl> <date>         <date>     <date>     <chr>  <dbl> <int> <date>    
#> 1   1000883 2012-04-01     2020-04-01 1949-02-10 F       2012  2012 2099-12-31
#> 2   1000883 2012-04-01     2020-04-01 1949-02-10 F       2012  2013 2099-12-31
#> 3   1000883 2012-04-01     2020-04-01 1949-02-10 F       2012  2014 2099-12-31
#> 4   1000883 2012-04-01     2020-04-01 1949-02-10 F       2012  2015 2099-12-31
#> 5   1000883 2012-04-01     2020-04-01 1949-02-10 F       2012  2016 2099-12-31
#> 6   1000883 2012-04-01     2020-04-01 1949-02-10 F       2012  2017 2099-12-31
#> # ... with 3 more variables: Claim <dbl>, Lapse_date <date>, Lapse <dbl>
